meanings.definition: Dishonest or immoral in a sordid or unattractive way.
meanings.sent1: The sleazier man tried to sell fake watches on the street.
meanings.sent2: The alley behind the old building felt even sleazier at night.
meanings.sent3: The sleazier salesman claimed his snake oil could cure anything.
meanings.sent4: The sleazier tactics of the corrupt politician were finally exposed.
meanings.sent5: The sleazier behavior of the con artist left a trail of victims.

meanings.definition: Of poor quality or appearance; shabby or dirty.
meanings.sent1: The sleazier motel had flickering lights and stained carpets.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the sleazier part of town looked even more rundown.
meanings.sent3: The sleazier costume fell apart as soon as he put it on.
meanings.sent4: The sleazier paint job on the car made it look like a rust bucket.
meanings.sent5: The sleazier furniture in the thrift shop was covered in dust and scratches.
